itemDescription: Welsh rugby union and rugby league footballer

wikipedia_page.main:
Jonathan Lynn Griffiths (born 23 August 1964) is a Welsh former rugby union, and professional rugby league footballer who played as a stand-off or scrum-half in the 1980s and 1990s.
Griffiths attained his first cap for the Wales national rugby union team 11 June 1988 versus New Zealand.
Griffiths was a Great Britain and Wales international and played at the 1995 Rugby League World Cup.
Jonathan Griffiths played Scrum-half in St. Helens 4-5 defeat by Wigan in the 1992 Lancashire County Cup Final during the 1992–93 season at Knowsley Road, St. Helens on Sunday 18 October 1992.As of 2013, Griffith's is a fireman in Pembrokeshire and a practising Christian.

link_mentions.page: 1994 Kangaroo tour of Great Britain and France
response: Although they were also without their superstar and inspirational captain Jonathan Davies who had dislocated his right shoulder in the first Ashes Test just 8 days earlier at Wembley, the Welsh team still boasted plenty of international rugby league experience with players like Phil Ford, Anthony Sullivan, John Devereux, Kevin Ellis, Jonathan Griffiths, Paul Moriarty and Rowland Phillips. In Davies' absence, the Dragons were captained by front row forward Dai Young. For the Australian's, only Greg Florimo had yet to play test football.
